definition: the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
(of a woman) lovely as a flower (idiom)/beautiful

sentences.english: Dear, you are responsible to support the family and I am responsible for my beauty.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的，你负责赚钱养家，我负责貌美如花。

sentences.english: You thin build, with beautiful youth, how Jiugei early climacteric of it.
sentences.chinese: 你瘦小的身材，貌美的青春，怎么就给提前更年了呢。

sentences.english: Yennenga was a beautiful young woman. Everyone loved her.
sentences.chinese: 叶尼佳年轻貌美，每个人都喜爱她。

sentences.english: Despite the girl's youth and beauty, it is the disabled man who is truly beautiful. True beauty comes from one's actions rather than one's appearance.
sentences.chinese: 虽然这个女孩年轻貌美，但真正美的是那位残疾人。

sentences.english: The young and beautiful lady is in fact a famous expert on virus.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻貌美的女士其实是位研究病毒的著名专家。

sentences.english: My aunt is famous for her beauty.
She was a young woman of good appearance.
sentences.chinese: 她是一位年轻貌美的女子。

sentences.english: Beauty without virtue is a flower without perfume.
sentences.chinese: 貌美而无德，犹如花之无香。

sentences.english: Shortage is still severe aimlessly flowery and good-looking youth.
sentences.chinese: 依旧漫无目的地荒度如花貌美的青春。

sentences.english: I did not love her, with all her young and beauty.
sentences.chinese: 她年轻貌美，但我却不爱她。

sentences.english: Is that a pretty policewoman on the no parking barrier?
sentences.chinese: 禁止停车的牌子是一个貌美的女警察吗？

definition: (of a woman) lovely as a flower (idiom)/beautiful
lit. countenance of a flower, face like the moon (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) beautiful
(of a girl) in the prime of youth
pleasant/agreeable/a person after one's heart (charming person)/a gifted person
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
